title: 108_s822
content: The "Child Care Lending Pilot Act of 2003" may be cited as the Short Title. It establishes the Child Care Business Loan Program. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans under certain restrictions and limitations. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to authorize loans with restrictions and limitations, including the use of proceeds and loans to small, non-profit child care businesses. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow loans for small, non-profit child care businesses, with specific conditions for approval and eligibility. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow financial assistance for non-profit child care businesses, meeting eligibility requirements for for-profit businesses. The Small Business Administration must submit reports on the program implementation every 6 months. The Small Business Administration must submit a report on the implementation of the program to the Senate and House Committees. The report should include the program implementation date and the issuance of rules date. The Small Business Administration must report on the program implementation date, rules issuance date, and loan details for the previous 6 months by March 31, 2006. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report on child care small business loans. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report on child care small business loans to the Senate and House Committees on Small Business, containing information from the first 2 years of the loan program. The report will include an evaluation of the timeliness of the loan program implementation, the effectiveness of Certified Development Companies, lenders, and small businesses in participating, and an assessment of how the program was marketed. The report will evaluate the loan program's implementation timeliness, effectiveness of Certified Development Companies, lenders, and small businesses' participation, and how the program was marketed. It will also include details on the number of child care small businesses that applied for, were approved for, and received loan disbursements under the program. The report will include details on businesses approved for loans and received disbursements under the program, including the number of businesses in each State, total amount loaned, and average loan amount and term. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration will issue final rules for the loan program within 120 days of the enactment of the Act. The amendments made by this section will be in effect until September 30, 2006, and will apply to all loans authorized by the Small Business Investment Act. The loan program rules will be finalized within 120 days of the Act's enactment and will be effective until September 30, 2006, applying to loans authorized by the Small Business Investment Act made during this period.
